I wish it was growing at all, I think I'm still losing it. May I not be as ignorant as my friends and family when they are in crisis. Mary, congrats on your celebration out w/hubby! Thanks for letting me rant gals. I can only bite my tongue for so long.

Posts.Content: Aug 5, 2011 01:28AM stjude10 wrote: I am new here, and I think the waiting is the hardest part. I too had a lump appear under my left nipple. I had the mammo, the 2nd mammo, and an ultrasound. My doctor's office called me w/the news that there was nothing out of the ordinary, and no lump was present. I decided to go w/my gut on this one and argued. After asking a lot of questions about said lump, and they couldn't give me answers, I think they sent me to a surgeon for a physical exam just to shut me up! Yep, IDC and getting the ball rolling now. I don't think I'm as worried about things now as I was. It's the not knowing that drove me crazy. Now we know, and are getting our plan in order. So glad I found this sight!! Lori

Posts.Content: Aug 6, 2011 12:52PM stjude10 wrote: Lavender-thanks for the encouraging words. My surgeon was fuming when it only took him about 10 seconds w/the ultrasound to find the tumor.
